page.title: 13Village May Festival
page.content: We celebrate the beginning of May by having a May Festival. It has been celebrated in our village for as long as anyone can remember. We do it at school. We choose a May Queen and a May King by secret ballot of all the children. After the Queen has been crowned and given an English rose we sing our own May Song. The infants then dance some simple traditional dances. It is then the turn of the older children who perform dances like The Flying Scotsman and the Durham Reel. Some of the girls do a clog dance and the boys a long sword dance. We end the first part of the festival with maypole dancing where we plait the ribbons on the maypole. We then parade around the arena with garlands we have made and then set off around the village in a procession headed by the May Queen.
